title: go-mdbx causing access violations on windows.
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: erigon version 2.53.2

OS & Version: Windows

Commit hash: N/A

Erigon Command (with flags/config): ./erigon

Consensus Layer: default

Consensus Layer Command (with flags/config): default

Chain/Network: default

#### Expected behaviour
Erigon to launch the default network and start syncing

#### Actual behaviour
Erigon instantly crashes due to an access violation caused by the go-mdbx package

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Launch erigon.

#### Backtrace

````
INFO[10-30|14:52:30.929] logging to file system                   log dir=C:\\Users\\owner\\AppData\\Local\\Erigon\\logs file prefix=erigon log level=info json=false
INFO[10-30|14:52:30.930] Build info                               git_branch= git_tag= git_commit=
INFO[10-30|14:52:30.930] Starting Erigon on Ethereum mainnet...
INFO[10-30|14:52:30.932] Maximum peer count                       ETH=100 total=100
INFO[10-30|14:52:30.932] starting HTTP APIs                       APIs=eth,erigon,engine
INFO[10-30|14:52:30.932] torrent verbosity                        level=WRN
INFO[10-30|14:52:33.062] Set global gas cap                       cap=50000000
INFO[10-30|14:52:33.108] [Downloader] Runnning with               ipv6-enabled=true ipv4-enabled=true download.rate=16mb upload.rate=4mb
INFO[10-30|14:52:33.109] Opening Database                         label=chaindata path=C:\\Users\\owner\\AppData\\Local\\Erigon\\chaindata
Exception 0xc0000005 0x8 0x0 0x0
PC=0x0
signal arrived during external code execution

runtime.cgocall(0x1e7f2b0, 0xc0005ba0c8)
        /usr/local/go/src/runtime/cgocall.go:157 +0x4a fp=0xc0005ba0a0 sp=0xc0005ba068 pc=0x14544a
github.com/erigontech/mdbx-go/mdbx._Cfunc_mdbx_env_create(0xc00090c180)
        _cgo_gotypes.go:643 +0x52 fp=0xc0005ba0c8 sp=0xc0005ba0a0 pc=0x5dec12

        /root/go/pkg/mod/github.com/erigontech/mdbx-go@v0.27.19/mdbx/env.go:137 +0x46 fp=0xc0005ba0f8 sp=0xc0005ba0c8 pc=0x5e3306
github.com/erigontech/mdbx-go/mdbx.NewEnv()
        /root/go/pkg/mod/github.com/erigontech/mdbx-go@v0.27.19/mdbx/env.go:137 +0x2f fp=0xc0005ba128 sp=0xc0005ba0f8 pc=0x5e31cf
github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon-lib/kv/mdbx.MdbxOpts.Open({{0x3220d68, 0xc0000a66a0}, 0xc000bce000, 0x2ec3c08, {0xc000902d50, 0x2d}, 0x0, 0x30000000000, 0x1000000, 0xffffffffffffffff, ...}, ...)
        /go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/erigon-lib/kv/mdbx/kv_mdbx.go:264 +0x31b fp=0xc0005ba6f0 sp=0xc0005ba128 pc=0xdb69fb
github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/node.OpenDatabase.func1(0x0)
        /go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/node/node.go:365 +0x7a8 fp=0xc0005baee0 sp=0xc0005ba6f0 pc=0x1a9cd28
github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/node.OpenDatabase({0x320d998, 0xc00004a0b8}, 0xc000dab000, 0x0, {0x0?, 0x0?}, 0x0, {0x3220d68, 0xc0000a66a0})
        /go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/node/node.go:368 +0x350 fp=0xc0005bafd8 sp=0xc0005baee0 pc=0x1a9c270
github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/eth.New({0x320d998, 0xc00004a0b8}, 0xc000c82000, 0xc000956e00, {0x3220d68, 0xc0000a66a0})
        /go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/eth/backend.go:233 +0x4be fp=0xc0005bd7e0 sp=0xc0005bafd8 pc=0x1e5535e
github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/turbo/node.New({0x320d998, 0xc00004a0b8}, 0x3220d68?, 0xc0000a66a0?, {0x3220d68, 0xc0000a66a0})
        /go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/turbo/node/node.go:122 +0xb1 fp=0xc0005bd848 sp=0xc0005bd7e0 pc=0x1e66b31
main.runErigon(0xc000c1cb00)
        /go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cmd/erigon/main.go:80 +0x445 fp=0xc0005bdae8 sp=0xc0005bd848 pc=0x1e7c3a5
github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/turbo/app.MakeApp.func1(0xc000c1cb00)
        /go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/turbo/app/make_app.go:43 +0xc2 fp=0xc0005bdbe8 sp=0xc0005bdae8 pc=0x1e70f82
github.com/urfave/cli/v2.(*Command).Run(0xc00080e420, 0xc000c1cb00, {0xc0000a4240, 0x1, 0x1})
        /root/go/pkg/mod/github.com/urfave/cli/v2@v2.25.7/command.go:274 +0x9eb fp=0xc0005bde88 sp=0xc0005bdbe8 pc=0x6854eb
github.com/urfave/cli/v2.(*App).RunContext(0xc00030d0e0, {0x320d998?, 0xc00004a0b8}, {0xc0000a4240, 0x1, 0x1})
        /root/go/pkg/mod/github.com/urfave/cli/v2@v2.25.7/app.go:332 +0x616 fp=0xc0005bdef8 sp=0xc0005bde88 pc=0x681e16
github.com/urfave/cli/v2.(*App).Run(...)
        /root/go/pkg/mod/github.com/urfave/cli/v2@v2.25.7/app.go:309
main.main()
        /go/src/github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cmd/erigon/main.go:41 +0x8f fp=0xc0005bdf80 sp=0xc0005bdef8 pc=0x1e7be6f
runtime.main()
        /usr/local/go/src/runtime/proc.go:250 +0x1f7 fp=0xc0005bdfe0 sp=0xc0005bdf80 pc=0x17fab7
runtime.goexit()
        /usr/local/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:1598 +0x1 fp=0xc0005bdfe8 sp=0xc0005bdfe0 pc=0x1b25a1
````

> @JABirchall do you start on empty datadir? or on existing one? removing of datadir/nodes folder - helps you?

There was no folders untill erigon was launched.
Also 99% of the time access violations are caused by memory violations, not files. 

so im 100% sure mdbx is doing something in memory it really shouldnt. or erigon is passing mdbx bad pointers

we have windows CI which creating many similar databases: 
https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/actions/runs/6695186624/job/18190176946

what is your: go version, mingw version? do you follow this guide https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon#windows ?


try start with: --log.console.verbosity=5 --database.verbosity=5

> we have windows CI which creating many similar databases: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/actions/runs/6695186624/job/18190176946
> 
> what is your: go version, mingw version? do you follow this guide https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon#windows ?
> 
> try start with: --log.console.verbosity=5 --database.verbosity=5

I didnt build it on my machine, i just downloaded the release.
But my go version is 1.21.1, no mingw

I Ill run it with the logs 1 second.

Update: log level 5 in a folder that didnt exist untill erigon was started.

```
N:\Polygon>erigon --datadir=./sddfgsdfgsfdg --log.console.verbosity=5 --database.verbosity=5
INFO[10-31|04:48:22.003] logging to file system                   log dir=sddfgsdfgsfdg\\logs file prefix=erigon log level=info json=false
```

is it easy for you - to try build on your machine?
git branch: `release/2.53`

The specific requirements for mingw and gcc does make it difficult to build on my machine. 
If the only requirement was go and cgo then i could build it and debug the issue myself.
@JABirchall I have fixed the issue by using the latest GCC compiler from mingw https://github.com/niXman/mingw-builds-binaries/releases. It could be also installed by the chocolatey manager

@kaliubuntu0206 maybe you can help us upgrade chocolatelaey and mingw on CI:
https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/blob/71d7e2c957dd5c6b5a56ed973d4fc52e8c7c537a/.github/workflows/ci.yml#L97
